model.nodes

Class AStarNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.nodes.Node
      • model.nodes.AStarNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AStarNode>

    public final class AStarNode
extends Node
implements java.lang.Comparable<AStarNode>
    A concrete node for use by an A* (A-star) search algorithm.
    Author:
    Ken Norman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AStarNode(int x, int y)
      Creates a new node for use by the A* (A-star) algorithm.

      • AStarNode

        public AStarNode(int x,
         int y)
        Creates a new node for use by the A* (A-star) algorithm. This class extends the abstract class Node.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate
        See Also:
        Node.Node(int, int)

    • Method Detail

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(NodeStatus status)
        Description copied from class: Node

        Sets the status of a node.

        NOTE: The initial status of a newly created node is EMPTY.

        Overrides:
        setStatus in class Node
        Parameters:
        status - The new status of the node.

      • getCostFromStart

        public double getCostFromStart()
        Gets the cost to reach this node from the start node. Often identified as g(n) or G.
        Returns:
        The cost.

      • setCostFromStart

        public void setCostFromStart(double g)
        Sets the actual cost from start node to the current node along the current path.
        Parameters:
        g - The actual cost.

      • getHeuristicCostToFinish

        public double getHeuristicCostToFinish()
        Gets an estimate of the expected cost to reach the finish node. Often identified as h(n) or H.
        Returns:
        The heuristic cost to finish.

      • setHeuristicCostToFinish

        public void setHeuristicCostToFinish(double h)
        Sets the estimated cost to reach the finish node from this node. The value is determined by the applied heuristic.
        Parameters:
        h - An estimated cost based on a heuristic.

      • getEstimatedTotalCost

        public double getEstimatedTotalCost()
        Gets the sum, f(n), of the actual cost from the start node, g(n), and the estimated cost to reach the finish node, h(n).
        Returns:
        f(n), where f(n) = g(n) + h(n).
        See Also:
        getCostFromStart(), getHeuristicCostToFinish()

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        A flag to indicate if this node is in the list of 'open' nodes (still possible candidates for inclusion in the solution). The full collection of open nodes represents the search horizon.
        Returns:
        true if the open list contains this node
        false otherwise.

      • setOpen

        public void setOpen()
        Identify the node as 'open' (i.e., in the open list).

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        A flag to indicate if this node is in the list of 'closed' nodes (already searched).
        Returns:
        true if the closed list contains this node
        false otherwise.

      • setClosed

        public void setClosed()
        Identify the node as 'closed' (i.e., in the closed list).

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Node

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(AStarNode other)
        Compares the return values of getEstimatedTotalCost() for two nodes.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<AStarNode>
        Parameters:
        other - The node to compare
        Returns:
        1 if this node's total cost is greater than the other node's total cost
        0 if both nodes have the same total cost
        -1 if this node's total cost is less than the other node's total cost
        See Also:
        Comparable.compareTo(java.lang.Object)
